intro: Lamium galeobdolon subsp. galeobdolon, commonly known as the purple deadnettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often purple-tinged on the underside, and it produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers in shades of purple and pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and meadows. It is part of the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive foliage. Lamium galeobdolon subsp. galeobdolon is often used in herbal medicine and as a ground cover in gardens.
